New Records: Glenn Maxwell slammed the fastest 100 in the history of the ICC World Cup as his ton came on just 40 balls.
Australia's win was the biggest in the World Cup in terms of margin of runs
Key Match Events: David Warner and Steve Smith smashed their respective half-centuries
Glenn Maxwell slammed fastest World Cup century in 40 balls
Logan van Beek clinched back to back wickets as he dismissed Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Stark
Pat Cummins finished Australia's innings with a FOUR
Australia hammered the Netherlands by 309 runs in New Delhi on Wednesday in a record World Cup rout
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's campaign has been inconsistent. After initial losses to South Africa and India, the Aussies have now bounced back to defeat Pakistan and Sri Lanka.
The Dutch have already proven to be formidable opponents, having defeated South Africa in the tournament's opening round.
The Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium itself brings another layer of unpredictability to the contest.

The statistics at Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium are intriguing. In 29 ODIs played here, 14 were won by the team batting first, and an equal number were claimed by the side chasing, with one match ending inconclusively.
Post-Match Reflections: Wrist spinner Adam Zampa picked four wickets for eight runs in three overs for Australia, as it cemented third place with six points from three wins in five games.
The margin of victory was the largest (by runs) in World Cup history and it sharply elevated Australia’s net run-rate from -0.193 to 1.142.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The highlight was Warner’s leaping catch at square leg to send back Sybrand Engelbrecht for 11 off Mitchell Marsh (2-19).
The Netherlands dropped from seventh to 10th in the table, with two points and below Sri Lanka, defending champions England and Bangladesh on run rate.
Others: The introduction of black-soil pitches has balanced the scales, making it a batter-friendly ground.
As for the tournament's games hosted at this venue, the results have been decisively one-sided, favouring the winning side with enormous margins.
